alert.note: Alert for Northwest Randolph; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A thunderstorm producing very heavy rainfall will impact portions of southwestern Randolph and east central Webster Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 629 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles northwest of Snowshoe, or 15 miles northwest of Cass Scenic Railroad, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rainfall could cause ponding of water on roads and localized minor water issues. Locations impacted include... Mingo, Monterville, Valley Head, Pickens and Waneta. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways - Turn Around, Don`t Drown!
